sections.title: Real Estate Financing Strategies
sections.subtitle: Mortgage options and financing techniques for investment properties

sections.title: What You'll Learn
items: Down payment requirements and loan terms

sections.title: Investment Property Loan Options
sections.content: Investment property loans typically require larger down payments (20-25%) and have higher interest rates than primary residence loans. Conventional loans, FHA loans (for multi-family), and portfolio loans are common options. Expect stricter underwriting standards for rental properties.

points.title: Conventional Loans
points.description: 20% down payment, good credit required, competitive interest rates for qualified borrowers.

points.title: FHA Loans
points.description: Lower down payments (as low as 3.5%) but limited to owner-occupied multi-family properties.

points.title: Private Money
points.description: Loans from private lenders or hard money lenders, higher rates but faster closing and less strict requirements.

sections.title: Interest Rates Matter
sections.content: A 1% difference in interest rate on a $200,000 loan can cost $2,000+ annually. Shop multiple lenders and consider rate buydowns for lower long-term costs.

sections.title: Creative Financing Strategies
sections.content: Beyond traditional mortgages, consider seller financing, lease options, or partnerships. House hacking (living in one unit of a multi-family property) can help you qualify for better loan terms and generate immediate income.

sections.title: Plan Your Financing Strategy
steps: Check your credit score and improve it if needed before applying for loans
Compare loan offers from multiple lenders including online platforms
Calculate the impact of different down payment amounts on cash flow
Consider house hacking or other creative strategies for your first property

sections.title: Build Lender Relationships
sections.content: Establish relationships with local banks and credit unions early. They often offer better terms and more flexibility than large national lenders for investment properties.
